name: Italian Trout Courgetti
ingredients:
- 300g courgettes
- 1shallot
- 1 garlic clove
- Handful of fresh flat-leaf parsley
- 240g chickpeas (drained)
- 30g sultanas
- 75g baby plum tomatoes
- 2 tbsp tomato puree
- 1/2 tsp red chilli flakes
- 80g almond yoghurt
- 2 hot-smoked trout fillets (skin on)
instructions:
- Peel the courgettes into ribbons. Slice the ribbons into long, thin strips (or use a julienne peeler or spiralizer if you have one). Finely dice the shallot. Finely chop or crush the garlic. Roughly chop the parsley. Drain the chickpeas and rinse.
- Heat a large saucepan with 2 tsp oil on a medium-high heat. Add the garlic, shallot and sultanas. Cook for 3 mins then add the tomatoes and cook for 2 mins, until soft. Add the chickpeas, tomato puree, chilli and half the parsley. Cook for 3 mins, then add 200ml water and simmer for 3 mins, until reduced.
- Add the courgetti to the saucepan for a final minute to heat through, stirring frequently, until slightly softened. Stir in the yoghurt; season with sea salt and black pepper. Remove the skin from the trout and flake the fish into small pieces over the top. Gently stir into the courgetti and leave for 1 min to heat through.
- 4. Serve the Italian trout courgetti garnished with the remaining parsley.
